questionListItems.title: How to I get PLD for my child/ward?

answer.body: The school will conduct a procurement exercise in the first Semester for new students in all levels from Sec 1-4. Students who miss this exercise can write to the HOD EdTech if they wish to procure an iPad through the school.

questionListItems.title: What is expected of a MEP student?

answer.body:
MEP Music replaces the Food & Consumer Education subject in Lower Sec. At Upper Sec, MEP Music is taken as an exam subject (at O-levels).


Beyond MEP lessons, MEP students will be involved in concert attendance, workshops, masterclasses, and MOE-MEP events.


Students are strongly encouraged to join a Music CCA (Choir, Handbell choir, String ensemble, Guitar ensemble) and take up a second instrument eg cello or double bass. Although a 2nd instrument is not compulsory, this can be a performing option in the Higher Music exam at ‘O’ level.


Lower Strings: To encourage more cellists and double bassists in the String Ensemble, there is a subsidy of 18 (1 hour) lessons for new cellists and double bassists in Sec / Year 1 (this does not apply to Sec /Year 2 to 4).

questionListItems.title: What are the fees for MEP?

answer.body: The Music Elective Programme (MEP) aims to nurture the academically able students who are musically inclined. It is a 4-year programme leading to O-level Higher Music. MEP students studying in MGS, enjoy a MOE subsidy of $200 per month for Independent School fees.

questionListItems.title: May I know the entry criteria for MEP in the Sec school?

answer.body:
Pupils who wish to take up MEP must first meet the entry requirement of the Express courses in the selected school.


All interested applicants (apart from DSA-MEP students) will sit for a Selection exercise on beginning of January. The Selection exercise comprises: a listening test, an aural test, an interview and a performance audition.

questionListItems.title: Will my child be left with only a PSLE certificate if she is unable to finish the 6-year programme?

answer.body: All students will receive 4 termly reports in each academic year in MGS & ACS(I). She can look forward to being awarded her IB Diploma when she completes her IB exams at the end of Year 6.

questionListItems.title: Must I take Higher Mother Tongue in the MGS IP?

answer.body: All MGS students who are offered Higher Mother Tongue are strongly encouraged to take up this opportunity to learn Mother Tongue at a first language level.

questionListItems.title: Is there any promotion criteria from Y1 to Y5?

answer.body: Yes, promotion criteria applies for students to be considered for promotion to the next level.

questionListItems.title: Is it compulsory to take Higher Mother Tongue in IP?

answer.body: It is not compulsory to take Higher Mother Tongue.

questionListItems.title: If my child is not able to cope with the MGS IP after the 1st year, what other options are there for my child? What is the drop-out rate?

answer.body:
As a school, we provide our fullest support to our students. This environment comprises the form teachers, subject teachers and Year Heads, and they monitor students’ progress and decide on a remediation programme to help students when necessary. Coupled with strong home-school partnership, we are confident of helping our students to do well in the MGS IP and thereafter in the IBDP.


All students who experience difficulties will have support. The school will discuss support and options with parents.

questionListItems.title: What other opportunities do I have if I am unsuccessful for the IP?

answer.body: Those are not successful in getting an IP place can apply for a place at Y3 IP when she is in Sec 2. Note that the number of vacancies available are limited.

questionListItems.title: Does Third Language replace any subject in the final computation of grades?

answer.body: Third language is taken as an additional subject and L3 marks are computed for the overall year end results.

questionListItems.title: Does the school provide any transport to the Third Language Centres?

answer.body: We do not provide any transport to the Third Language Centres.
Yes, IP students can apply to do MEP. IP students will sit for the Higher Music paper in the GCE ‘O’ level examinations.

questionListItems.title: Can I switch from Higher Mother Tongue to Mother Tongue at the end of Year 1?

answer.body: The switch from Higher Mother Tongue to Mother Tongue is possible at the end of Year 1. You can discuss with your parents and teachers to make a decision.
